intro: Urobotrya angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed rockrose, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Geraniaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly in South Africa. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of pink or red flowers that bloom in summer. It is typically found growing on rocky outcrops and in sandy soils, adapting well to harsh environmental conditions. Urobotrya angustifolia is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
